c.t: MCC.6.3.010 Pardon and Forgiveness Screening Committee Responsibilities
c.sp: library|Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Code of Law|MCC|MCC.6|MCC.6.3|MCC.6.3.010

c.x: In the absence of an appointed Committee, the Tribal Governing Board shall
A Committee is hereby created to act in an advisory capacity to the Tribal
The Tribal Governing Board, by formal action, shall appoint a Liaison(s) wh
promulgate internal standard operating procedures necessary to govern its p
review and process applications for a pardon or forgiveness in an orderly a
review an applicant's background investigation report and drug test results
conduct and preside over hearings;
provide formal, written recommendations to the Tribal Governing Board to ap
take other actions reasonably related to the purpose of the Committee.
None of the powers and duties may be construed or interpreted to empower th
Official Powers and Duties. The Committee shall carry out the following off
The Pardon and Forgiveness Screening Committee shall be composed of five (5
The Tribal Governing Board shall recruit and post vacancies of the Committe
With the consensus of the Tribal Governing Board, the Board may appoint up
Applicants and recommended ex officio Committee members shall submit to a b
Organization. The Committee shall be organized in accordance with the follo
Be an enrolled Member of the Tribe.
Be at least 21 years of age.
Have obtained a High School Diploma or GED equivalent or a degree of Higher
A felony.
Fraud or misrepresentation in any connection.
Have no prior record of, or entry of a plea of no contest to, any of the fo
Shall not be an elected tribal official.
Shall comply with an approved code of ethics.
Qualifications. Applicants for appointment to the Committee must satisfy th
All members of the Committee shall be appointed for three (3) year, stagger
The Tribal Governing Board shall appoint a Commissioner for all vacancies t
Appointments shall occur on the anniversary date of the Committee member's
A member of the Committee may be removed by formal action of the Tribal Gov
The Committee shall be appointed, and may be reappointed, by the Tribal Gov
The Committee member shall be appointed, and may be reappointed, by the Tri
Term. The Tribal Governing Board may appoint applicants, who meet the quali
Officers. Officers of the Committee shall be Chairman, Vice-Chairman, and S
Quorum. A majority of the full Committee shall constitute a quorum necessar
Voting. All Committee member are entitled to vote on all issues. At the cal
Regularity of Meetings. Regular meetings of the Board shall be held quarter
Proceedings. All deliberations of the Committee, except in Executive Sessio
Review of applications submitted pursuant to Section MCC.6.3.030 of this or
Hearing deliberations pursuant to Section MCC.6.3.050(e) of this ordinance;
Conferring with the Office of the Attorney General who is rendering oral or
Executive Sessions. The Committee may consider the following matter(s) in e
Appointed members of the Committee shall receive a stipend of one hundred d
Training for Committee members to effectively and diligently carry out the
Compensation of Committee Members.
Meetings.
No Committee member shall deliberate on an application involving a conflict
Nothing in this ordinance authorizes the Committee to interfere with manage
Restrictions.
Committee members shall discharge their duties in good faith and in a manne
Committee members shall, at all time, subordinate their personal interests
No Commissioner shall commit any act with respect to the Tribe, the Committ
Care, Loyalty, and Conflict.
To the fullest extent permitted by law, the Tribe shall indemnify members o
The Committee, as a delegated body of the Tribal Governing Board pursuant t
Personal Liability and Immunity.

One (1) year after an act is committed, or affirmed through the conclusion
Eligibility. A Tribal member may receive a pardon for any criminal convicti

information regarding the conviction(s) for which the applicant is seeking

clergy or other spiritual leaders;
employers and/or community members;
teachers;
organizers of support groups the applicant attends or has attended.
letters of reference or support from people well-regarded in the community.
any other information relevant to the applicant's conviction(s) or rehabili
proof of payment of all penalties and fines.
A completed pardon application shall include the following:
a copy of the applicant's Tribal enrollment card, if applicable;
the applicant's employment record prior to the act, if applicable;
the applicant's background records;
the results of a drug test (if applicable);
the act that triggered the applicant's ineligibility;
the impact of the act on the Tribe;
the length of time since the act;
a written statement from the applicant demonstrating remorse for the violat
two (2) letters of recommendation, with no more than one (1) recommendation
any additional credible and relevant information;
proof of payment of all penalties and fines.
A completed forgiveness application shall include the following:
Required Application Information. Each applicant is responsible for submitt
the application being returned with a request for more information; or
the application being removed from consideration; or
denial of a pardon or forgiveness.
Incomplete Application Consequences. Failure of the applicant to provide a

denial of the application.
